question.title: Will the United Auto Workers endorse Bernie Sanders for president by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Auto Workers (UAW) officially endorses Bernie Sanders for the presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UAW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If no endorsement is made by the resolution date, or if the UAW endorses a different candidate, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will the lawsuit filed by X (formerly Twitter) against a media company be dismissed by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the lawsuit filed by X (formerly Twitter) against a media company is officially dismissed by the court. The dismissal must be documented in official court records or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or Bloomberg). question.title: Will Rand Paul publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on healthcare funding?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz receive over $500 million in grants for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mercedes-Benz is confirmed to have received more than $500 million in grants from the U.S. federal government for electric vehicle-related initiatives. These initiatives may include manufacturing, assembly, or other aspects of electric vehicle production. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will Bristol Motor Speedway file a lawsuit against Tennessee's top health official by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bristol Motor Speedway or its owners officially file a lawsuit against Tennessee's top health official (such as the Commissioner of the Department of Health) regarding the speedway's closure during the COVID-19 pandemic. The filing must be confirmed through official court records or statements from the speedway's legal representatives, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, local Tennessee newspapers, or national news outlets). The lawsuit must specifically relate to allegations of violations by the state health official or administration during the pandemic-related closure. If no such lawsuit is filed by the resolution date, or if a lawsuit is filed but does not meet these criteria, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for two consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 250,000 for two successive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Indonesia eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

The rise must be officially documented by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government entity (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If such an increase is not documented within this period, the answer will be NO. It is crucial to emphasize that this question specifically addresses month-over-month changes, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Canara Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Canara Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). These new curbs must be distinct from any existing regulations as of October 1, 2023, and must directly impact Canara Bank's lending operations. If no such new curbs are announced by the specified date, or if any announced curbs do not specifically target Canara Bank's lending practices, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Alabama Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Alabama Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Alabama legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Georgia officially conducts a referendum regarding education reform. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will Arizona conduct a public vote on abortion rights before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially carries out a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the state government of Arizona.
2. The public vote must directly pertain to the topic of protecting abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be reported by official state sources or reputable news outlets.

This question will be answered negatively if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Nicolas Maduro publicly condemn the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro makes a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters. If no such condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is vague or does not specifically mention the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Denver by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Denver, Colorado. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Denver rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the NFL officially announce plans to use AI for game strategy analysis by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the National Football League (NFL) officially announces a plan to use AI technology for analyzing game strategies. The announcement must come from an official NFL source, such as a press release, official statement, or announcement during an NFL event. The plan should specifically state the intention to implement AI technology for game strategy analysis. The announcement must be reported by at least two major sports news outlets (e.g., ESPN, NFL.com, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic). question.title: Will the Taiwan Weighted Index reach or exceed 20,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Taiwan Weighted Index reaches or exceeds 20,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Taiwan Stock Exchange. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

para_P.title: Will NASA's Orion spacecraft achieve a crewed return journey from the ISS by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Slack lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Elim Chan be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Elim Chan is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on her age at the time of her appointment to a major orchestra, such as the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that she is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern in July 2022. question.title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on environmental policies by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of environmental policies. The referendum must be related to implementing significant changes in the state's environmental regulations or policies. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the South Dakota state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will Sudan report over 50 cholera-related deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official reports confirm that the cholera outbreak in Sudan has resulted in more than 50 deaths. Confirmation must come from at least one of the following sources: Sudanese health authorities, the World Health Organization (WHO), or reputable international news agencies (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC) citing official figures. question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mandatory wellness program by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mandatory wellness program for beneficiaries. The wellness program must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. question.title: Will Belarus withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus publicly announces the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous retraction of Belarus's application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus joins the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these business schools. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced amount is less than $600 million, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of the donation, not its completion.

question.title: Will AbbVie allow generic production of its rheumatoid arthritis drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, AbbVie officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its rheumatoid arthritis drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if AbbVie continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average weekly jobless claims in the U.S. fall below 200,000 for any month by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is at least one calendar month where the average weekly jobless claims in the United States fall below 200,000. The average will be calculated based on the official weekly jobless claims reports for all weeks within a given month, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor. For verification, data from the U.S. Department of Labor or reports from at least three major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) will be considered. If no such month occurs where the average weekly jobless claims fall below 200,000, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI research lab's chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri has officially implemented a free community college plan. question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive outcome, this recognition must be validated through official statements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The official recognition must categorize Mexico as a full member, rather than merely an observer or associate member. If such recognition is not achieved by the resolution date, or if Mexico's membership remains under consideration or pending, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) publicly declares that it has completed its investigation into the pricing practices of at least five major pharmaceutical companies. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Oscar Mayer issue a recall of hot dogs due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oscar Mayer officially announces a recall of any of its hot dog products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Oscar Mayer's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Oscar Mayer
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning an Oscar Mayer recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body:

2. A press release issued by Oscar Mayer
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically refers to an Oscar Mayer recall
4. Reports from a minimum of three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is announced by the indicated date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the FCA announce completion of a major financial fraud investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Riverside County authorize events on citrus orchards by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is an official policy change or announcement by local authorities in Riverside County, California, allowing events such as weddings and cultural events to be hosted on citrus orchards. question.title: Will Switzerland's SMI index reach or exceed 12,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Switzerland's SMI index reaches or exceeds 12,500 points. The 12,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the SIX Swiss Exchange. If the index does not reach 12,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 12,500 points.

question.title: Will Florida implement a free community college plan by July 2024?

question.title: Will Bank of India issue pass-through certificates worth at least $1 billion by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bank of India issues pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. The issuance must be confirmed through official announcements by Bank of India or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The pass-through certificates must be issued as part of a strategy to manage the bank's loan portfolio or address funding gaps. If no such issuance meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, or if the total value is less than $1 billion, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Rovira's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Rovira is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The resolution of this question is not dependent on the outcome of any potential trial.

The recall must specifically address door latches that may fail to secure properly, as indicated by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). Verification of the recall's commencement must come from official communications from Peugeot or be reported by at least two reputable news sources. A NO response will be given if Peugeot has not issued such an announcement or started a recall by the specified date, or if the total number of affected vehicles is 720,000 or fewer.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Sweden announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Swedish government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of the Environment, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of the Environment, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Swedish government makes an official declaration regarding the construction of any new nuclear reactors. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will France's CAC 40 index reach or exceed 7,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, France's CAC 40 index reaches or exceeds 7,500 points. The 7,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Euronext Paris. If the index does not reach 7,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 7,500 points.
